title: A suggestion for Yasuo's updated wall
body:
Just a suggestion for the upcoming Yasuo rework.

Why not tweak his wall, so that the remaining duration is heavily reduced after the first projectile is blocked.
That way he can still make quick-reaction plays by blocking incoming ults like Ez or Ashe, but it stops him from winning teamfights fights just by throwing it up mid fight and cutting the entire team's damage in half for 4 seconds. A little like new Sejuani's passive, after being hit, it remains a little while longer, but much less than it would if not hit.

_(as well as clearly define what is classified as a 'projectile'. as some abilities are blocked and clearly shouldn't be, Taliyah's R for example.)_

This keeps true to his 'fast, action-packed, playmaking' type playstyle, but limits the overbearing utility he brings to teamfights.

Obviously I'm known for being fairly anti-Yasuo, so I have indeed forfeited much of my credibility when it comes to this subject. But this is my 'tame' suggestion at least, take from it what you will.

_Personally id like to see him with mana (or at least energy like Lee Sin), as well as with a slower attack speed offset, and smaller attack range ._ _But I may be hung drawn and quartered for even suggesting such things._

But I think you misunderstand us, we aren't saying that Yasuo is an instant win whenever you pick him, nor are we saying that theres nothing you can do against him.

What we are saying is because of how his kit is set up, with short cooldowns, manaless abilities, and consistent high sustained damage. He has less downtime than other champions, and so more opportunities to recover.

Meaning, when in a fight with champions, if he makes a mistake or misses part of hit kit, he isn't left defenceless, and still has access to the majority of his kit.
Meanwhile other champs are left more vulnerable when they miss abilities, or make bad plays.

So in a fight between LeBlanc and Yasuo, if LeBlanc lands 100% of her abilities, she will probably win. However she is hard to play, and hitting a target as mobile as Yasuo isn't an easy task, so if she misses her abilities, she is at his mercy.

However if Yasuo misses his abilities, he still has 80% of his kit up at all times, and so can immediately try again. So if both he and LB make mistakes, he can recover while she can not, and the fight turns to his favour.

So this ability to recover from mistakes, coupled with the fact that both his dash and his windwall, actually cause the enemy to make mistakes. Means that unless his opponent plays absolutely perfectly, Yasuo has the upper hand.

and in lower elo unlike Diamond, people don't play absolutely perfectly all the time. People make a lot of mistakes, so Yasuo consistently gets the upper hand in many of the fights.
